Detailed Description

template<class T>
class Matrix3< T >

Class for matrix 3x3.

Note:
Data stored in this matrix are in column major order.

Parameters:

c Angle (in radians) of rotation around axis Z. 
01424          {
01425             Matrix3<T> ma, mb, mc;
01426             float ac = cos(a);
01427             float as = sin(a);
01428             float bc = cos(b);
01429             float bs = sin(b);

01432 
01433             ma.at(1,1) = ac;
01434             ma.at(2,1) = as;
01435             ma.at(1,2) = -as;

01437 
01438             mb.at(0,0) = bc;

01442 
01443             mc.at(0,0) = cc;
01444             mc.at(1,0) = cs;
01445             mc.at(0,1) = -cs;
01446             mc.at(1,1) = cc;
01447 
01448             Matrix3<T> ret = ma * mb * mc;
01449             return ret;

template<class T>
bool Matrix3< T >::operator== ( const Matrix3< T > &  rhs  )  const [inline]

Equality test operator.

Parameters:
rhs Right hand side argument of binary operator.
Note:
Test of equality is based of threshold EPSILON value. To be two values equal, must satisfy this condition all elements of matrix | lws[i] - rhs[i] | < EPSILON, same for y-coordinate, z-coordinate, and w-coordinate. 
01480          {
01481             for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01482             {
01483                if (std::fabs(data[i] - rhs.data[i]) >= EPSILON)
01484                   return false;
01485             }
01486             return true;
01487          }

template<class T>
Matrix3<T> Matrix3< T >::operator * ( Matrix3< T >  rhs  )  const [inline]

Multiplication operator.

Parameters:
rhs Right hand side argument of binary operator. 
01661          {
01662             static Matrix3<T> w;
01663             for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) 
01664             {
01665                for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) 
01666                {
01667                   T n = 0;
01668                   for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) n += rhs.at(i, k) * at(k, j);
01669                   w.at(i, j) = n;
01670                }
01671             }
01672             return w;
01673                 
01674          }

template<class T>
Matrix3<T> Matrix3< T >::lerp ( T  fact,
const Matrix3< T > &  rhs 
) const [inline]

Linear interpolation of two vectors.

Parameters:
fact Factor of interpolation. For translation from positon of this matrix (lhs) to matrix rhs, values of factor goes from 0.0 to 1.0.
rhs Second Matrix for interpolation
Note:
Hovewer values of fact parameter are reasonable only in interval [0.0 , 1.0], you can pass also values outside of this interval and you can get result (extrapolation?) 
01704          {
01705             Matrix3<T> ret = (*this) + (rhs - (*this)) * fact;
01706             return ret;         
01707          }
